title: Task 49

question.text: During a class reunion, an old friend tells you, We met for the first time in art class. What is your friend referring to with met?

answers.answer: We are meeting right now in art class
answers.feedback: The use of met indicates a past event, not something happening currently.

answers.answer: Our first encounter was in the past, specifically in art class
We will meet for the first time soon
answers.feedback: Met indicates a past action, not a future arrangement.

answers.answer: We have never been in art class together

description: In the simple past tense, some verbs are irregular and don't follow the regular -ed ending pattern. One example of this is the verb meet, which becomes met in the past tense. This is important to remember when talking about past events.
